snippet: President Obama, in his first formal remarks since the night of his re-election, said he would open discussions with Congressional leaders next week to seek a compromise.
abstract: President Obama, in his first formal remarks since the night of his re-election, said he would open discussions with Congressional leaders next week to seek a compromise.
lead_paragraph: President Obama, in his first formal remarks since the night of his re-election, said he would open discussions with Congressional leaders next week to seek a compromise, and then, before an applauding crowd of supporters in the White House’s East Room, defended the “detailed plan” that he campaigned on — including higher taxes on the wealthy.

headline.main: Transcript and Video of Obama’s Remarks on the Deficit
